page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: The two top classes of Lenham County Primary School have taken part in the Domesday Project. There were 60 children involved so we divided into 12 groups, each of 5 children accompained by a teacher or parent,& set out to survey our 12 square kilometre blocks. We looked for changes, we mapped out areas & we took photographs. We made a second visit to places of particular interest; the sewerage works, the Fire Station, the Police Station, Lenham Storage etc. We made up a questionnaire, which was filled out by 200 householders, & we talked to residents. Then we put together all the information & wrote our sheets. We had to leave a lot out. We enjoyed the work & we hope the result will be useful. We found everyone very helpful & kind. Lenham is a friendly place.
